photos.description: The newly graduated Ken before going to the U. of W. in the fall. One of my favorite pictures - pretty well sums up my young life at Orcas. (Ken)
photos.notes: TBD

photos.description: Duplicate of Image 0198.
photos.notes: DUPLICATE - see 0198

photos.description: Ken in his 14' Ski Boat with his 'crash' jacket on. Something his mother insisted on. I spotted a boat like this while attending the Sammamish Slough Races in Bothell and immediately knew I had to have one like it. It nearly jumped out of the water - and was a great ski boat for anyone who wished to chance it. In return they would then have to drive the boat so I could ski! That thing flew - without a doubt one of the fastest things anywhere near Pt. Lawrence. I sold it a couple of years later to buy an inboard boat which I named Circe' after the Greek Goddess of Magic. (Ken)
photos.notes: TBD

photos.description: A portrait of Mabel Culver's father, Dr. Charles Carroll Smith. The Smith's were neighbors of the Culver's in Gaysville. He fought at Gettysburg, and served in the Vermont legislature. His middle name is where Carrol Culver's name came from. (David Hall)
photos.notes: TBD

photos.description: Looking down at the snow-covered Farmhouse barnyard. This is one of the photos that used to be kept in the Alderbrook farmhouse parlor. Date unknown. (David Hall)
photos.notes: TBD

photos.description: Mabel Culver outside the OH Culver home on Ellis Street in Bellingham.
photos.notes: The only other photo I have of Mabel Culver. I've been told that she didn't much care to have her picture taken. Date unknown. (David Hall)

photos.description: O.H. Culver in the San Juan Islander office.
photos.source: Mrs. George Hipkoe (this came from Ken Culver's 'Heydey's of Salmon' presentation given to the Whatcom Museum of History and Art and was scanned from a book but I am unclear which book I obtained this from).
photos.notes: Ken will try and make a video presentation of his 'Heydays of Salmon' talk which he gave to several different groups in Bellingham including the Yacht Club, Hobby Club, and the Whatcom Museum. The subheading is 'Life Growing up at an Early Fishing Resort.'

photos.description: Family gathering at Nell Rothenhoefer's house. Back Row left to right: Michael Rothenhoefer, Bruce Culver, Dr. Joe Weir, Ken Culver, Bill Rothenhoefer. Front Row left to right: Jean Culver, Carolyn Culver, Nell Rothenhoefer, Weir boy (name?), Beth Weir, Weir Daughter, Dorothy Rothenhoefer.
photos.source: Jean Culver's autobiography 'Recollections of My Life'
